intro: Browallia texana, commonly known as Texas browallia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage is lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Browallia texana is valued in gardens for its vibrant blooms and relatively low maintenance requirements.
